question: The current in a coil changes from 2A to 5A in 0.3s. The magnitude of emf induced in the coil is 1.0V. The value of self-inductance of the coil is
explanation: EMF <katex>$|\varepsilon| = L \frac{di}{dt}$</katex>. Given <katex>$\varepsilon = 1$</katex>, <katex>$di = 5 - 2 = 3$</katex> A, <katex>$dt = 0.3$</katex> s. <katex>$1 = L \times (3/0.3) = 10L$</katex>. <katex>$L = 0.1$</katex> H = 100 mH.
